Metadata: Terror attacks on our seaports and coastal environment-​�America's primary maritime issue
Proceedings of the Coastal Society 2002 Conference "Converging Currents: Science, Culture and Policy at the Coast," Galveston, Texas, May 22, 2002.

This presentation from the Coastal Society 2002 Conference discusses the vulnerability of American shores and ports to terror attacks, due to the length of coastline, sheer numbers of cargo containers, and current laws and customs regulations. The author briefly reviews new and proposed legislation that could improve maritime security measures, and also the roles of international and state law.
